alert.note: Alert for Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 1:49AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following county, Fleming. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flemingsburg, Poplar Plains, Craintown, Pecks Ridge, Mount Carmel, Wallingford, Elizaville, Goddard, Nepton, Foxport and Ewing.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
